intro: Senecio cachacoensis, commonly known as the Cachacoensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a disk-like structure surrounded by ray florets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
